text: Legislative elections will be held in El Salvador in 2021 to elect the 84 members of the Legislative Assembly and 262 mayors.Big Victory Comes With Big Expectations for El Salvador’s Young New President World Politics Review, 11 February 2019 ==Electoral system== The 84 members of the Legislative Assembly are elected by open list proportional representation from 14 multi-member constituencies based on the departments, with seats allocated using the largest remainder method.El Salvador Election Passport ==Parties== ===Parliamentary parties=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! rowspan=2 colspan=3 width=225px | Name ! rowspan=2 | Ideology ! rowspan=2 | Leader ! colspan=2 | 2018 result |- ! Votes (%) ! Seats |- ! style="background:#08088A; width:2px;"| | align=center | ARENA | Nationalist Republican | National conservatism | Erick Salguero | align=center | 41.72% | |- ! style="background:#FF1111; width:2px;"| | align=center | FMLN | Farabundo Martí | Socialism | Óscar Ortiz | align=center | 24.54% | |- ! style="background:#4BC0C7; width:2px;"| | align=center | GANA | Grand Alliance | Conservatism | Andrés Rovira | align=center | 11.45% | |- ! style="background:#448de8; width:2px;"| | align=center | PCN | National Coalition | Nationalism | Manuel Rodriguez | align=center | 10.87% | |- ! style="background:#00A550; width:2px;"| | align=center | PDC | Christian Democratic | Christian democracy | Rodolfo Parker | align=center | 3.11% | |- ! style="background:#FFFF00; width:2px;"| | align=center | CD | Democratic Change | Social democracy | Douglas Avilés | align=center | 0.94% | |- |} ===Non-parliamentary parties=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! colspan=3 width=225px | Name ! | Ideology ! | Leader |- ! style="background:#104d8f; width:2px;"| | align=center | V | VAMOS | Centrism | Josué Alvarado |- ! style="background:#449adf; width:2px;"| | align=center | N | New Ideas | Conservative liberalism | Nayib Bukele |- ! style="background:lightgreen; width:2px;"| | align=center | NT | Our Time | Humanism | John Tennant Wright Sol |- ! style="background:green; width:2px;"| | align=center | DS | Salvadoran Democracy | Humanism | Adolfo Salume Artiñano |} ==Opinion polls== The following table lists estimates of intention to vote nationwide. Refusals are generally excluded from those of the party's vote, while the wording of the questions and the treatment of the answers "I don't know" and those that do not intend to vote may vary among the voting organizations.
